parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate. It discusses the issue of mosquito-borne diseases and preventative measures, featuring an interview with biologist Aurelian Pintiliescu.  There is no mention of any political candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and addresses a public health issue relevant to a wide population. The reach estimate is ">1M", indicating a broad target audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to raise awareness about mosquito-borne diseases and the importance of preventative measures. While the topic might indirectly relate to public policy and government responsibility, the post does not explicitly advocate for or against any candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post presents information in a journalistic style, featuring an interview with an expert on the topic. It aims to inform the public about a relevant health issue, rather than influencing votes.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post presents factual information and an expert's opinion, not a personal opinion unrelated to the election.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1648066156116529</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while categorized as "POLITICAL" due to its subject matter (public health), does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post focuses on a public health issue, presenting information and an expert's opinion on mosquito-borne diseases and preventative measures. It does not endorse or oppose any candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections.  The post's aim is informative, not persuasive in an electoral context.  The presence of a link to a website further suggests a journalistic or informative intent rather than an attempt to influence voting behavior.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Videomedicina.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
